Description: An introduction to the Spanish language in the context of Hispanic cultures.

 Hispanic cultures.

A continuation of the development of listening, speaking, reading and writing skills using a variety of material

Further develops skills and techniques for understanding written Spanish; conducted in English. Credit not

This course provides an intensive grammar study and further written practice to help advanced intermediate
 students express complex ideas in Spanish.

This course provides reading techniques and develops oral skills to help advanced intermediate students

Study of the modern Spanish sound system with special emphasis on pronunciation and intonation.

Translation practice with Spanish texts using principles and techniques learned in the lecture class. To be taken
 concurrently with TRST 30230.

Course Name: CONVERSATION FOR BUSINESS AND SPECIAL PURPOSES:SPANISH
Description:
Introduction to the special vocabulary of business and other special subject areas; introduces the concept of
 language for special purposes and emphasizes the use of special vocabularies in conversations in business and
 other settings.

Outline of the development of modern Spanish-American literature (1882 to the present). Reading of

General survey of evolution of Spanish civilization from antiquity to present day.

Course Name: CULTURE AND CIVILIZATION OF LATIN AMERICA
Description:
A thematic approach to the study of four or five representative Latin American countries focusing on 19th-and
 20th-century Latin American culture and society.

Focuses on description, summary, narration, exposition and argumentation on topics dealing with diverse areas
 of Hispanic culture as presented through literary and non-fiction texts.
A study of selected sociological, political, cultural or economic issues in the contemporary Hispanic world.

Theory and practice course that discusses translation theory and emphasizes Spanish-to-English translation of
 selected texts in business, technology, medicine and law.

Survey of the typical text types of business in the Spanish culture and language. Practice sessions focus on
 reading and understanding specialized texts and on the translation and composition of selected special texts in
 Spanish.

Description: The development of the Spanish-American short story from 1917 to the present.

Description:
The course focuses on a representative selection of literary pieces in Spanish by recent U.S. Latino writers
 developing oral and listening skills in Spanish and strengthening critical thinking on various cultural and literary
 matters.

This course provides a critical analysis of cultural and literary issues on texts dealing with early colonial
 Spanish-American expression.

Focuses on description, summary, narration, exposition and argumentation on topics dealing with diverse areas

Prerequisites: TRST 60010 and SPAN 68010; and graduate standing.
Description:
Provides advanced intensive practice in the translation of a variety of texts into Spanish. Translation issues and
 appropriate strategies are identified. Also provides practice in the evaluation of translations, the identification of
 professional issues, and an advanced review of linguistic and grammatical aspects of Spanish as they apply to
translation. Class meetings are conducted in a workshop format based on weekly assignments of readings and
 translation exercises.

Translating documents from a variety of literary and cultural sources, including literature, expository and
 journalistic prose, scholarly treatises and essays. Translation into Spanish will also be emphasized.

An introduction to methods and resources for the translation of commercial,economic financial legal diplomatic
 and governmental documents.

Description:
An introduction to methods and resources for the translation of scientific, technical, industrial and medical
 documents.
Thesis students must continue registration each semester until all degree requirements are met.

(Repeatable for credit)Intensive study of one or two major dramatists or movements in the history of Spanish
 and Spanish-American theatre.

(Repeatable for credit)Intensive study of one or two major poets or of a movement in the history of Spanish
 and Spanish-American poetry.

Students will be responsible for a major translation and a terminology glossary as well as a critical analysis of
 the source text, the problems encountered during the translation process and the strategies used to solve them.
